about_the_game:
Einstein’s Cats is a snug, single-player puzzle game based around verbal logic. “Black cats love tall boxes.” “Jasper is not a white cat.” “Cat’s wearing a bow hate being down low.” Carefully read the clues, carefully evaluate your cats, and carefully place them into their correct spots - on the shelf, on the floor or into the plant pot.

FEATURES

  • Cats. Black cats. White cats. Calico cats. Cats in hats. Cats in bows. Cats in hats with bows on them. If you ever, while playing this game, start to feel that there aren’t enough cats, please take a moment and really think about it.

  • 90+ levels to enjoy, with varying levels of challenge and complexity! Relax in cozy greenhouses, cafes, and even outer space!

  • Charming hand drawn art, in a paper-crafts style!

  • A lovely scrap-book to arrange and display all the stickers you collect throughout the game!

Your Brain is the Perfect Scratching-Post!

Tricky, but not frustrating. One step at a time, the way all the clues mix and twist and interact; this kind of cat loves being next to that kind of cat– okay. That cat hates being next to the other kind of cat, which also likes being up high, but only in a short box. Okay. Carefully arrange the cats on the screen, one by one. Take your time. Take a breath. Take your little pat on the back when you finally get it– you’ve earned that. 

So Many Cats!!

Wait, really? Seriously? You still think there aren’t enough cats in this game? And did you– oh. You sat and you thought about it? And even after sitting and thinking about it, you still don’t think there are enough cats?

Huh. Well. Okay, then. Guess it needs some more cats. Here are some more cats. Better?

Good.

short_description: Cats in boxes; alive or dead? Wait, no, no this isn’t Schroedinger. This is Einstein’s Cats! A cozy, relaxing logic puzzle game about cats and boxes; which cats go where? But be careful, you know how picky cats can be!
